page.title: 12MORE CHILDREN'S GAMES
page.content:
{FOX AND HOUNDS There are two teams; one is the fox and the other the hounds. The fox team makes up a word with a letter for each person in the team, then they go and hide. The hounds team hunt them out, get the letters one at a time, and make up the word.
{HOPSCOTCH} This is a game played in the playground. Sometimes it is called 'Peevers' in Scotland. A set of numbered squares is drawn in chalk or painted on the tarmac and the players kick a tin while balancing on one leg. They must land on squares, not lines, or they are out. When a player has visited all the squares once, he chooses one of his own and the others must never set a foot in it when it is their turn to play.
